ProposalInformation.Title: NIRCam Absolute FGS-NIRCam Alignment
ProposalInformation.Abstract:
This proposal acquires the data needed to align the FGS and NIRCam & NIRISS apertures to facilitate updates to the JWST focal plan model through the SIAF data base. This version of the proposal assumes that the capability for FGS and NIRCam imaging in parallel will NOT be available when this proposal executes. If parallel imaging does become available, this version of the proposal is to be supplanted with a revised proposal.
The HST/JWST astrometric field in the LMC along with the extended HAWK-I and GAIA astrometric fields will serve as the sky reference for the WCS (ICRS) catalog against which the NIRCam and FGS data are to be compared. Without the FGS & NIRCam parallel imaging available, the NIRCam-FGS alignment data must be infered by the relative positions of stars imaged by NIRCam and the associated guide stars used by FGS. Since at least five guide stars at different locations in each FGS are needed to align NIRCam and the two FGS channels, this will be a 10 visit proposal. Moreover, since the data are gathered in multiple visits, the S/C will transition from Fine Guidance Control (FGC) to COARSE pointing control between visits, so roll shifts of up to 15" (3-sigma expected performance) may occur, which if unaccounted for introduces astrometric errors in the alignment measurement of up to ~50 mas. To better measure the relative roll between the visits, the NIRCam images are supplemented with NIRISS images to increase the lever arm length of the roll measurement. This provides the additional benefit of gathering the data needed for the NIRISS to FGS alignment in parallel with the FGS to NIRCam alignment.
NOTE: If the capability to use FGS in parallel w/ NIRCam is implemented for commissoning, THIS ACTIVITY NEED NOT BE EXECUTED.
HOWEVER: The FGS images in parallel must be added to NIRCam-021 / pid 1069. This will require some coordination in order to get images in FGS1 (while guiding using ONLY FGS guide star candidates), and vice versa.
ProposalInformation.ExplainUnschedulable: I have no explanation why these visits are not scheduable!
ProposalInformation.ObservingDescription:
NIRCam and NIRISS images of stars in the JST LMC astrometric field and the surrounding HAWK-I and GAIA stars, along with astrometric guide stars are used to acquire the data needed to determine the position of NIRCam and NIRISS w.r.t. Guider1 and Guider2. The FGS data relies on the measured positions of selected guide stars. Each guider will utilize five different guide stars distributed across the FGS FOV, with the NIRCam and NIRISS positions held steady (identical foot print on the sky) for each visit. By obtaining NIRCam and NIRISS images in parallel, it will be possible to better constrain the knowledge of the relative S/C roll between guide star acquisitions.
NOTE: APT determines these visits to be unscheduable. Apparently this is due to the "Guide Star ID" special requirement. Observations 21 and 22 are present only to demonstrate that the PAV3 roll angle constraint is not the source of unscheduability.
